Support for multiple phonetic fields in SFM/Toolbox data source records:
SurveyItem.ItemDescription:
Some users have SFM data sources containing multiple
Phonetic fields per record and currently PA can only read
one. This feature would allow PA to read any number of
phonetic fields per record. The following SFM record
exemplifies a common practice by including a plural
form (\plph) of the phonetic word (\ph).

ef 001
\ph fut
\ge foot
\plph fit

SurveyItem.ItemText: Support for automatic creation of XY charts:
SurveyItem.ItemDescription:
This feature would provide a means for users to generate various XY charts
based on the phones found in a project’s data sources. For example, after
having specified a series of environments in the first row of a chart, the
search items in the search items column could be automatically filled with
all the consonants or vowels found in the data.

SurveyItem.ItemText: Support for showing Speech Analyzer views (e.g. pitch plot):
SurveyItem.ItemDescription: This would apply to PA records\nhaving associated audio files.

Example: If the user creates a class of labial plosives (Class A),
and another class of labial fricatives (Class B), improved class
definition support would allow creating a class based on classes
A and B which represents the union of A and B.
These charts would be similar to the suprasegmental\nand diacritic charts found in Phonology Assistant 2.0.
